explanation: - osal_objtype_t: This is the declared type of the function parameter idtype. To decide if the function is modifying a parameter you must know whether idtype is an integer/enum passed by value (allowed to be read) or a pointer/reference type (modifying the pointer itself would be a MISRA violation). Also check for const qualifiers.\n- OS_impl_objtype_lock_table: This global (or macro) is indexed with idtype (impl = OS_impl_objtype_lock_table[idtype];). You must inspect its declaration/definition to confirm it is an array or pointer-to-array (standard indexing, no side effects) and not a macro or function-like construct that could modify idtype as a side effect.\n- OS_impl_objtype_lock_t: The type pointed to by the table entries. While this does not directly affect whether idtype itself is modified, its declaration confirms that impl is a pointer derived from the table lookup (i.e. no aliasing that would imply idtype is being modified), and helps rule out any nonstandard operator overloading/macro tricks in field accesses that could alter the parameter.
